h1: How Many Calories in 1 Pound Ground Beef?
assumptions: 80% lean / 20% fat ground beef, pan-broiled (cooked) with fat drained; 1 pound = 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, draining, and brand. Values are approximate; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 pound of cooked 80% lean ground beef contains about 1117 kcal and 113 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

Add 1 tsp oil per 100 g during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 pound of 80% lean ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 1117 kcal when cooked and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 pound ground beef?
faqs.a: About 113 g of protein for cooked 80% lean ground beef.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes; pan-broiling and draining fat reduces calories compared to raw or fried without draining.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 1 pound ground beef?
faqs.a: Around 73 g total fat, including 29 g saturated, for 80% lean cooked.

faqs.q: What if I use leaner ground beef?
faqs.a: 90% lean cuts calories to ~907 kcal per pound, with less fat but similar protein.
